answers.author: Mike Cohen
answers.text:
Hi Christina,
The challenges for local governments in using internet technology to augment citizen feedback include keeping the feedback civil and open as well as compliant with First Amendment freedom of speech and public records laws. 
One solution to those challenges is for local governments to use an internet-based public comment forum with the order and decorum of conventional public hearings. 
I append some examples below.
Regards,
Mike
Salt Lake City UT:
http://www.slcgov.com/opencityhall/?pd_url=http://www.peakdemocracy.com/portals/79/forum_home?a=86 
Palo Alto CA:
http://www.cityofpaloalto.org/knowzone/open_city_hall/default.asp?pd_url=http://www.peakdemocracy.com/portals/5/forum_home?a=77

answers.author: Robert Bell
answers.text:
There are two levels of challenge.  One is to get the basics of e-government working: automating processes to save money, providing valuable information and services online, using e-procurement to expand the base of vendors.  These can all be challenging enough but there are good models for it in many places.  The other aspect is how to use a community's investments in IT and communications technology to leverage economic growth and meet social challenges.   Ensuring that your businesses and citizens have the online access and tools to grow.  Attracting and fostering leading edge businesses.  For more, see the Community Profiles at www.intelligentcommunity.org.
